timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer if this sort of stuff was in the Compat infrastructure so we didn't spread the API-dependent conditionals across the codebase. Not sure how to do that well when there are related public methods like here though 🤔 might be this is as good as it gets and we already have to do a full code scan for API codes anyway, so maybe just think about it for a timebox of no more than two minutes, and leave as is if it doesn't seem easy to fit into Compat/CompatV16/CompatV23
timeline.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: I couldn't and can't see a way to make this fit in as we inherit from an API23+ class - the conditionals are (nicely) hidden away in the Builder so they won't be seen by consumers, but it's still unpleasant.

timeline.message:
DeckPicker: Added badge for unsynced changes

Note: This does not yet handle normal syncs - only no account or full syncs

This also changes the default menu name from "Synchronization" to "Sync"

Fixes 3524

Unsynced changes badge - handle regular changes

We implement this by listening to the database and triggering a flag if any
modifications are detected via SQL.

This is similar to DB.java, but works at a lower level, as we
often call getDb().getDatabase()

_recoverOrphans has an update which generally does nothing
As it's performed when the DeckPicker is loaded, we don't want this
to set the preference
